revised_title: Isolation and Properties of Larixinic Acid from Larch Bark
tldr: The author, John Stenhouse, discovered a crystallizable volatile principle called Larixinic Acid in the bark of the Larch Tree. He described its preparation, properties, and reactions with various substances. Larixinic Acid is a unique substance found only in the larch tree and belongs to a small group of substances that includes pyrogallic acid and pyrochatechin.
